A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I had just turned five in 1977 when I saw Star Wars; so\, like many\, I grew up with Star Wars.  I read over sixty of the Expanded Universe books and took Disney's punch in the gut (i.e. acting like they never happen)\, but I kept a positive attitude\, saw TFA and loved it.   Moved on to Rogue One and can honestly say it's one of my favorite Star Wars movies.

I guess Disney felt like I needed another punch in the gut\, because they made this movie.  I could go on about the plot holes and underdeveloped characters\, but I simply cannot get past the Luke Skywalker portrayed in this movie.   The EU books did a phenomenal job of portraying Luke's flaws\, but gave us the Hero we knew and loved.  THE GRUMPY OLD MAN IN THIS MOVIE WAS #NOTMYLUKE


This movie will make a ton of cash\, but it won't get another penny from me...
